definition: the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea./universally abhorrent
group/crowd/flock, herd, pack etc
variant of 群[qun2]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to attack/to accuse/to study
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: It could not be a worse time for a politician to launch broadsides at a central bank.
sentences.chinese: 当政客们对央行群起而攻之时，情况坏得不能再坏了。

sentences.english: Asing if agree, traditional media is opposite suddenly Gu Ge group rise and attack.
sentences.chinese: 仿佛是约好的，传统媒体突然对谷歌群起而攻之。

sentences.english: EU parties to immediately react strongly, to discredit a rare exception.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟各方随即做出强烈反应，异常罕见地群起而攻之。

sentences.english: In the forum, a wealth of neticizens still attacked Zhang fiercely.
sentences.chinese: 在论坛里，看到不少网友依然对章子怡群起而攻之。

sentences.english: They were quick to attack any changes in the method.
sentences.chinese: 如果该政策遭到任何改变，他们会群起而攻之。

sentences.english: They charged that I had threatened them with concentration camp .
sentences.chinese: 他们群起而攻之，说我是在用集中营威胁他们。

definition: public anger/popular indignation
to vilify sb wantonly/unrestrained attack (on sb)
to attack sb by exposing faults/to denounce
to offend
to provoke anger
lit. target of a multitude of arrows (idiom); the butt of public criticism/attacked on all sides
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
to issue a call for action/to raise one's hand and issue a rousing call (idiom)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
public enemy
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to change sides in a war/turncoat
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to make a false countercharge
